info.name: Karya
info.description: This is the Postman collection to interract with the REST APIs exposed by the Karya Server. This can be used to create various clients so that they can interract with Karya. Do have a look at the [documentation](https://github.com/Saumya-Bhatt/karya/blob/main/docs/documentation/ARCHITECTURE.md) online for more details.

item.name: Users

request.description: This endpoint will create a user according to the details specified. Currently there are no validations to this endpoint and is not idempotent.
This endpoint can be used to get the details of a user by passing their username

item.description: Only a user which has been registered with Karya can submit plans. This section here details how to interract with the user data component.

item.name: Plans
Submit Plan

request.description:
This sample here provides a plan to:

- Creating a **bounded recurring** action.
    
- Action is making a POST call to an endpoint provided.

This sample here provides a plan to:

- Creating a **bounded recurring** action.
    
- Action is to push a message to a Kafka Topic
    

> NOTE: The message pushed will be a JSON message

This sample here provides a plan to:

- Create a one-time action.
    
- Action is to trigger another plan once the current one is triggered.
    
    - The chained plan is a bounded recurring plan.
        
    - The action of this chained plan is to make a GET request to the endpoint specified.

item.name: One-Time REST API Action with Completion Hook

request.description:
This sample here provides a plan to:

- Create a one-time action.
    
- Action is to make a REST API call to the endpoint specified.
    
- A completion hook is specified which wil make a REST call to the endpoint specified.

response.name: 200 Response

request.description:
This sample here provides a plan to:

- Create a one-time action.
    
- Action is to send an email with the contents specified to the reciever mentioned in the plan.

response.name: 200 Response
response.body:
{
    "id": "af3ae25c-47d6-40a6-b69d-ba66377129b7",
    "user_id": "f9663146-1a82-476a-b097-3e5e1b8c113c",
    "description": "Sample delay email run",
    "period_time": "PT5S",
    "type": {
        "type": "karya.core.entities.PlanType.OneTime"
    },
    "status": "CREATED",
    "max_failure_retry": 3,
    "action": {
        "type": "karya.core.entities.Action.EmailRequest",
        "recipient": "recipient@gmail.com",
        "subject": "Karya notification",
        "message": "Hello from Karya!"
    },
    "hook": [],
    "parent_plan_id": null,
    "created_at": 1734335554279,
    "updated_at": 1734335554279
}

request.description:
This sample here provides a plan to:

- Create a bounded recurring action.
    
- Action is to write a message to a slack channel.

response.name: 200 Response

item.description:
Karya provides enough flexibility to configure the following factors, hence allowing users to create their custom workflows:

1. Should the plan be _one-time_ or _recurring_ in nature
    
2. What action to trigger. Currently supported actions are:
    
    1. Making REST API call.
        
    2. Pushing a message to a Kafka Topic.
        
    3. Writing a message to a Slack Channel.
        
    4. Sending an email.
        
    5. Chaining other plans.
        
3. Specify any hooks if needed. Currently supported hooks are:
    
    1. `ON_COMPLETION`
        
    2. `ON_FAILURE`
        

Refer to the documentation - [Connectors ](https://github.com/Saumya-Bhatt/karya/blob/main/docs/documentation/CONNECTORS.md) and [Hooks](https://github.com/Saumya-Bhatt/karya/blob/main/docs/documentation/HOOKS.md) section for more details.

> **NOTE:** Setting `end_at` to `null` will make the plan **Unbounded** meaning it will run forever. It is recommended to provide some value to this key (making the plan **bounded**) so as to prevent a task from keep on running.

request.description:
This endpoint takes in the `plan_id` in the path and returns

- The details of the plan submitted.
    
- The current status of the plan.
    
- The details of the next task in the plan to be executed if any.

response.name: 200 Response

request.description:
This endpoint here provides information regarding:

- The details of the plan submitted.
    
- The current status of the plan.
    
- A list of all the tasks that were executed as part of the plan.
    
- Error logs of any of the tasks which were executed.

response.name: 200 Response

request.description:
This endpoint helps update an existing plan. One can change:

- the frequency of the plan
    
- the number of times to retry if a task within the plan fails
    
- attatch any hooks to the plan
This endpoint takes in a `plan_id` in the request path and cancels the plan.

response.name: 200 Response
200 Response
response.body:
[

item.description:
A user needs to provide a _plan._ A plan is the blueprint for:

1. What action to perform.
    
2. At what frequency should the action be performed.
    
3. If/Any action to take if the said plan fails/finishes execution.
    

This folder specifies all the endpoints that one needs to interract with plans.

request.description: A health check endpoint to see if the Karya Server is up and running.
If `metricsEnabled` is set to true in the `server.yml` config, Karya will expose a set of metrics that can be scraped by prometheus on this endpoint.

response.name: 200 Response
